activities.loc: Courtroom E, Fourth Floor - South Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Patrick D. Sims

records.addlTxt: Letter from Courts to Parties RE Competency Evaluation

2:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Patrick D. Sims appeared by video with guardian Aliyah Easter.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by video for Patrick D. Sims. Attorney Murphy requests competency evaluation. Matter to be set.
Preliminary hearing on August 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:37 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Patrick D. Sims appeared by video.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by phone for Patrick D. Sims. Preliminary hearing requested within time limits by zoom.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity: initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:56 PM Defendant Patrick D. Sims in court in custody appearing by video with attorney Anna Elizabeth Hartz by video .  David S Olson appeared by video  for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Signature bond set of $1,000.00 with standard conditions and No contact directly or indirectly with victim J.J., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.  Curfew of 6 pm to 6 am unless at work or going to and from work.    May not possess any weapons.  Absolute sobriety.  Take all medications as prescribed. Matter continued to allow defendant time to obtain an attorney. Adjourned initial appearance July 27, 2022 at 1:00 pm.
